channel.title: How Do You Change The Mining Ore Respawn Time?
channel.description: I was wondering how to change the spawn time for ores, like rune takes forever to respawn how do i change the time on it?

item.title: How Do You Change The Mining Ore Respawn Time?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Is it really that hard to tell what the times are? I mean, just look at the array.

The first 3, are the ID the ore ID, and the level required

So for the time being

Data = {ID, Ore, Level, blank, blank, blank}

The fourth one is most likely exp.

Data = {ID, Ore, Level, Exp, blank, blank}

Now what about the timer one? It’s quite obvious, really. Iron and tin / copper do not have the same timer, so that strikes out the last one as being the timer.

So
Data = {ID, Ore, Level, Exp, Timer, blank}

I’m not so sure what it is, it’s most likely a “difficulty level” for the ore’s object.

If you’re going to change rune, change the “40” to a lower number.

Read full topic
item.source: How Do You Change The Mining Ore Respawn Time?

item.title: How Do You Change The Mining Ore Respawn Time?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“elite expert, post:3, topic:525361”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=644105.msg4334789#msg4334789 date=1374182383]
There is a 75% chance it’s handled in the same class the rest of the mining is handled in.
[/quote]
I feel like its in this area on the mining.java file can u tell me what the numbers are

private static int[][] data = {
	{2091, 436, 1, 18, 1, 5},	//COPPER
	{2090, 436, 1, 18, 1, 5},	//COPPER
	{2094, 438, 1, 18, 1, 5},	//TIN
	{2095, 438, 1, 18, 1, 5},	//TIN
	{2093, 440, 15, 35, 2, 5},	//IRON
	{2092, 440, 15, 35, 2, 5},	//IRON
	{2097, 453, 30, 50, 3, 8},	//COAL
	{2096, 453, 30, 50, 3, 8},	//COAL
	{2098, 444, 40, 65, 3, 10},	//GOLD
	{2099, 444, 40, 65, 3, 10},	//GOLD
	{2103, 447, 55, 80, 5, 20},	//MITH
	{2102, 447, 55, 80, 5, 20},	//MITH
	{2104, 449, 70, 95, 7, 50},	//ADDY
	{2105, 449, 70, 95, 7, 50},	//ADDY
	{2100, 442, 20, 40, 5, 5},	//SILVER
	{2101, 442, 20, 40, 5, 5},	//SILVER
	{2106, 451, 85, 125, 40, 100},//RUNE
	{2107, 451, 85, 125, 40, 100},//RUNE
};[/quote]

did you even read the array code?

objectid, exp, levelreq, ? , ? , ?

not sure what last 3 are without seeing mining class

Read full topic
item.source: How Do You Change The Mining Ore Respawn Time?

There is a 75% chance it’s handled in the same class the rest of the mining is handled in.

	{2091, 436, 1, 18, 1, 5},	//COPPER

	{2099, 444, 40, 65, 3, 10},	//GOLD
	{2103, 447, 55, 80, 5, 20},	//MITH
	{2102, 447, 55, 80, 5, 20},	//MITH
	{2104, 449, 70, 95, 7, 50},	//ADDY

	{2100, 442, 20, 40, 5, 5},	//SILVER

	{2106, 451, 85, 125, 40, 100},//RUNE

yo, unfortunately the creator is a scumbag and used an array so for us outsiders we have no clue which parameter is which
